meanings.definition: A set of 24 or 25 sheets of paper.
meanings.sent1: I need a quire of paper to complete my project.
meanings.sent2: The printer ran out of paper, so I grabbed a quire from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used a quire of paper to make a tiny nest.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed onto the pages like a quire of paper unraveling.
meanings.sent5: The teacher handed out a quire to each student for the assignment.

meanings.sent1: I will quire about the availability of the product at the store.
meanings.sent2: She decided to quire the librarian for more information about the book.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat began to quire about the mysterious noise in the attic.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to quire deeply into her soul, searching for answers.
meanings.sent5: The detective continued to quire witnesses for clues to solve the case.
